Quick search

Module: scal¶

class apercal.modules.scal.scal(file_=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Selfcal class to do the self-calibration on a dataset.

amp()[source]¶

Executes amplitude self-calibration with the given parameters

averagedata()[source]¶

Averages the data to one channel per subband for self-calibration

check_starting_conditions()[source]¶

Check that the miriad file from convert exists.

If it does not exists, none of the subsequent tasks in go need to be executed. This seems necessary as not all the tasks do this check and they do not have to. A single task is enough.

Not sure if it is necessary to add all the param variables from selfcal and set them False if the check fails. For now, just use the main one

Args:
self
Return:
(bool): True if file is found, otherwise False
flagline()[source]¶

Creates an image cube of the averaged datasets and measures the rms in each channel. All channels with an rms outside of a given sigma interval are flagged in the self-calibration, continuum and polarisation imagaing, but are still used for line imaging.

go()[source]¶

Executes the whole self-calibration process in the following order: averagedata flagline parametric phase amp

parametric()[source]¶

Parametric self calibration using an NVSS/FIRST skymodel and calculating spectral indices by source matching with WENSS.

phase()[source]¶

Executes the phase self-calibration with the given parameters

reset()[source]¶

Function to reset the current step and remove all generated selfcal data for the current beam. Be careful! Deletes all data generated in this step!

reset_all()[source]¶

Function to reset the current step and remove all generated selfcal data for the all beams. Be careful! Deletes all data generated in this step!

summary()[source]¶

Creates a general summary of the parameters in the parameter file generated during SELFCAL. No detailed summary is available for SELFCAL up to now.

returns (DataFrame): A python pandas dataframe object, which can be looked at with the style function in the notebook
